channel.title: CVE Feed for Elastic -- Kibana
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Elastic -- Kibana

item.title: CVE-2017-8440|2024-08-05T16:34:22.872Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Starting in version 5.3.0, Kibana had a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Discover page that could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from or perform destructive actions on behalf of other Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2017-8439|2024-08-05T16:34:23.050Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana version 5.4.0 was affected by a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) bug in the Time Series Visual Builder. This bug could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2018-3820|2024-08-05T04:57:24.036Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions after 6.1.0 and before 6.1.3 had a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in labs visualizations that could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from or perform destructive actions on behalf of other Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2017-8452|2024-08-05T16:34:23.316Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions prior to 5.2.1 configured for SSL client access, file descriptors will fail to be cleaned up after certain requests and will accumulate over time until the process crashes.

item.title: CVE-2018-17246|2024-08-05T10:47:04.056Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions before 6.4.3 and 5.6.13 contain an arbitrary file inclusion flaw in the Console plugin. An attacker with access to the Kibana Console API could send a request that will attempt to execute javascript code. This could possibly lead to an attacker executing arbitrary commands with permissions of the Kibana process on the host system.

item.title: CVE-2018-17245|2024-08-05T10:47:04.122Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions 4.0 to 4.6, 5.0 to 5.6.12, and 6.0 to 6.4.2 contain an error in the way authorization credentials are used when generating PDF reports. If a report requests external resources plaintext credentials are included in the HTTP request that could be recovered by an external resource provider.

item.title: CVE-2018-3818|2024-08-05T04:57:23.014Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions 5.1.1 to 6.1.2 and 5.6.6 had a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability via the colored fields formatter that could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from or perform destructive actions on behalf of other Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2018-3830|2024-08-05T04:57:24.498Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions 5.3.0 to 6.4.1 had a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability via the source field formatter that could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from or perform destructive actions on behalf of other Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2018-3821|2024-08-05T04:57:23.975Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions after 5.1.1 and before 5.6.7 and 6.1.3 had a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the tag cloud visualization that could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information from or perform destructive actions on behalf of other Kibana users.

item.title: CVE-2018-3819|2024-08-05T04:57:22.975Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: The fix in Kibana for ESA-2017-23 was incomplete. With X-Pack security enabled, Kibana versions before 6.1.3 and 5.6.7 have an open redirect vulnerability on the login page that would enable an attacker to craft a link that redirects to an arbitrary website.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-08-02T03:50:55.963Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-08-02T03:50:55.975Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-07-30T21:48:17.598Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-23443|2024-06-19T13:47:29.166Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 17 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.

item.title: CVE-2024-23442|2024-06-14T14:26:53.169Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-06-13T17:04:41.737Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-06-13T19:11:54.538Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-23442|2024-06-14T18:01:40.563Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-23443|2024-06-21T14:43:38.725Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 17 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-07-31T13:59:39.692Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.
